title: Yellow cold-health alert issued across the South West
description: A YELLOW cold-health alert has been issued across the South West. The alert has been issued by the UK Health Security Agency and the Met Office, who warn of cold temperatures from 9am today (Saturday, January 6) to noon on Friday, January 12. Widespread frosts and lower temperatures than normal are expected.

title: Letter: All Politicians Are Not the Same
description: The world is still full of ghastly authoritarian leaders – Putin, Xi, Modi, Erdogan, Orban etc – who are desperate for us to give up on liberal democracy but whose own long-term futures look far from secure. title: Letter: 'Top-down housing targets are deeply disappointing'
description: It is deeply disappointing that the Government continue to enforce top-down housing targets. There is a lot of misleading commentary floating around. If councils had been given the power to set their own housing targets, we would have jumped at the opportunity, to say otherwise, as some are, is deliberately misleading.

title: Ben Lowry: Unionists have slowly lost faith in any idea of the best of both worlds from the EU and UK
description: 1. Northern Ireland remains entirely in the UK internal market, and has no barriers, indeed no legal change with the rest of UK, despite Great Britain having left the EU single market. At the same time, NI, alone in the UK, has full, unfettered access – no checks or forms whatsoever – to the EU single market, but no legal exposure to EU laws.

title: SNP MP to bring forward bill to ban unpaid trial shifts if UK Government fails to act
description: An SNP MP has warned the UK Government that he will bring forward a bill to ban unpaid trial shifts if it does not take action. Stewart McDonald wrote to Tory Business Secretary Kemi Badenoch asking for her to ban the "exploitative" practice last month.

title: What the papers say – January 6
description: The i weekend focuses on “bin chaos” in towns and cities across the UK, which it says is leading to infestations of rats. And the FT Weekend says the British Library will “drain around 40% of its reserves” as it rebuilds after a cyber attack.
